sub_title: Senior Liaison Officer at Wageningen Centre for Development Innovation WCDI - Wageningen University & Research WUR
summary:
I am a versatile professional, with keen interest in the life sciences domain. My work areas include (agricultural) research, extension, communication, editing, relation management, acquisition and contracting.

After graduating in 1987 at Wageningen University , I started my professional career working as a crop protection researcher in projects in Niger and Bhutan. In 1995, having completed five years of research work in Africa and Asia, I travelled to Latin America to become adviser in training, communication and organisational development for organisations in Peru and Honduras. Travelled back to the Netherlands in 2003, and worked as an editor of an international magazine on low external input agriculture. In 2006, I joined Hivos, to help developing project proposals with Southern partners, monitor project implementation in the field, provide administrative project support and liaise with funding agencies. Also contributed to the fund raising policy development of Hivos. Since 2010 I am employed with Wageningen Centre for Development Innovation (CDI), being responsible for acquisition and contracts, help develop CDI’s acquisition strategy and increase the funder portfolio.
